page.title: 09Thatching At Wickham St.Paul
page.content: On Thursday 25th April we talked to Mr. Potter,a master thatcher and Mr. Mann his apprentice about their thatching work on a{cottage roof}at Wickham St. Paul's Village Green. They were using reeds from Scotland. {Reeds}also come from Norfolk.They use {straw}for the top of the roof.The pattern at the top is individual to each Thatcher.Reeds are up to eight feet long and last for one hundred years.It takes two months to thatch a cottage roof.Straw lasts for fifteen to twenty years. {Tools used by a thatcher are : {Leggett}- to straighten reeds in place {Shears}- to cut reeds and straw. {Rake}- to comb out straw. {Mallet}- to drive pegs into reeds. {Hammer}- to bang in iron hooks driven into rafters. {Wire netting}- to keep birds out.
